parameters.name: AtIndex
parameters.description: Index position within the current list of selected items where index ranges from 1 to ISelectionMgr::GetSelectedObjectCount2 (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Mark
parameters.description: -1 = All selections regardless of marks 0 = only the selections without marks Any other value = Value that was used to mark and select an object

title: ISelectionMgr.DeSelect2
signature:
System.Int32 DeSelect2( 
   System.Object
AtIndex
,
   System.Int32
Mark
)

parameters.name: AtIndex
parameters.description: Index position within the current list of selected items where index ranges from 1 to ISelectionMgr::GetSelectedObjectCount2 (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Mark
parameters.description: -1 = All selections regardless of marks 0 = only the selections without marks Any other value = Value that was used to mark and select an object

returns: 1 if the specified entity is deselected, 0 if not
remarks:
If running SOLIDWORKS x64, then you must declare AtIndex as a Long in VBA.
AtIndex should be either an array of 32-bit integers or a single 32-bit integer. See
Long vs. Integer
for details about data types.
